conversation_metadata.title: Resolving Routing Conflicts in Next.js App

executive_summary: A 2-hour New Year's Eve MORNING session (06:28-08:23) debugging Next.js routing conflicts for a profile page with 'values cards' and 'friend perspectives'. This is likely the Friend Reflection Tool - a personal project integrating values frameworks (connects to Intrinsic Meaning conversation #11). SAME DAY as Parliaments work (#6) but 14 hours earlier. Shows New Year's Eve: morning debugging (IAP) → evening product development (CAP).
attention_policies: MOMENTS when technical problems block meaningful projects
PATTERNS where New Year's Eve includes both debugging and creation
SPACES where values frameworks need technical implementation

The 'values cards' and 'friend perspectives' mentions strongly suggest this is the Friend Reflection Tool - implementing values frameworks.
analyst_notes.pattern_recognition: Clear IAP - technical debugging is obligation/maintenance. BUT it serves a CAP (Friend Reflection Tool for values work). This is IAP→CAP relationship: debugging enables meaningful work.
analyst_notes.new_years_eve_pattern: Same day as Parliaments (#6): 06:28-08:23 debugging → 14-hour gap → 23:14-00:16 product development. Shows New Year's Eve as PREP DAY (unblocking) + PLANNING DAY (Insight Journalism pivot).
